definitions.definition: Of or relating to atoms; composed of atoms; monatomic.
definitions.example: A stream of atomic hydrogen is emitted.

definitions.definition: Employing or relating to nuclear energy or processes.
definitions.example: We built a small atomic bomb in the garage.
The hairs on a bedbug are almost atomic.

definitions.definition: Unable to be split or made any smaller.
definitions.example: A bit is an atomic item of data.

definitions.definition: Of an operation: guaranteed to complete either fully or not at all while waiting in a pause, and running synchronously when called by multiple asynchronous threads.
definitions.example: In order to avoid race conditions, this operation has to be atomic.

definitions.definition: (of a commit in a VCS) Containing a single change, as opposed to involving numerous unrelated changes.
